title.rendered: Rafael Nadal’s comeback delayed due to an injury

content.rendered:
The next Grand Slam tournament isn’t until the French Open in late May and early June, which is an event Rafael Nadal would undoubtedly love to play in.

Nadal has won the French Open a record 14 times, which is a big reason why he is tied with Novak Djokovic for the most men’s Grand Slam singles titles of the Open Era with 22.

The 2023 BNP Paribas Open will start on March 6, and Nadal’s non-availability will mark the most successful players from the tournament history not being present.

Nadal has won the tourney three times, and he is one of only five men’s players to accomplish that feat. He reached the final last year, where he surprisingly lost to American Taylor Fritz.

The 2023 Miami Open will start on March 19, and it will remain one of the rare events that Nadal has never won.

While Rafael Nadal has reached the Miami Open final on five occasions, he has been short of the title each time.

If Nadal’s goal is to be ready for the 2023 French Open, he may be targeting a return during the clay-court season so he can play in a few warm-up tournaments before the big one.

The coming Grand Slam event is not until the French Open in late May and early June, which is an event the Spaniard would love to play in. Read more: Winners Of The FIFA Awards 2023

Nadal has won the French Open a record 14 times, which is a big reason why he’s tied with Novak Djokovic for the most men’s Grand Slam mates’ titles of the Open period with 22.

The 2023 BNP Paribas Open is set to begin on March 6, and Nadal’s absence will mean one of the most successful players in the history of the event will not be entered.

Nadal has won the competition three times, and he’s one of only five men’s players to negotiate that feat. He reached the final last time, where he unexpectedly lost to American Taylor Fritz.

The 2023 Miami Open will start March 19, and it’ll remain one of the rare events that Nadal has no way won.

While Rafael has reached the Miami Open final on five occasions, he has fallen short of the title each time.

Still, he may be targeting a return during the complexion-court season. So that, he can play in many warm-up events before the big bone. If Nadal’s thing is to be ready for the 2023 French Open.
